title: "overflow evaluating the requirement" regression in nightly-2020-12-27

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```rust trait Foo {} trait Bar { type Corge; } struct Fuga { _a: T, } struct Piyo { _b: T, } impl Foo for Piyo {} impl Bar for Fuga where T: Bar, Self::Corge: Foo, { type Corge = Piyo; } fn main() {} ``` ## Error On current nightly or stable `1.49.0`, `rustc` errors with: ``` error[E0275]: overflow evaluating the requirement ` as Bar>::Corge == _` --> src/bin/demo.rs:17:1 | 17 | / impl Bar for Fuga 18 | | where 19 | | T: Bar, 20 | | Self::Corge: Foo, 21 | | { 22 | | type Corge = Piyo; 23 | | } | |_^ | = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `Bar` for `Fuga` error[E0275]: overflow evaluating the requirement ` as Bar>::Corge == _` --> src/bin/demo.rs:22:5 | 22 | type Corge = Piyo; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `Bar` for `Fuga` error: aborting due to 2 previous errors For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0275`. ``` but on `nightly-2020-12-20` it compiles without issue. `bisect-rustc` gives: searched nightlies: from nightly-2020-12-22 to nightly-2021-01-06 regressed nightly: nightly-2020-12-27 searched commits: from https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/bb178237c5539c75e1b85ab78a8ab902b1f333d5 to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/0b644e419681835bd0f5871c3bfbd648aa04f157 regressed commit: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/931aa27922b521d89d472f385882b921d3f8d624
bisected with cargo-bisect-rustc v0.6.0 Host triple: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu Reproduce with: ```bash cargo bisect-rustc ```
